result.execSummary:
All charges against Matthew A. White in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew A. White is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case Called: 2:08pm
INCLUDES 13CF706, 15CF693, 15CF694, 15CF1203, 15CM2205
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Deft appears in person, in custody, with Atty Wright Laufenberg.
  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW
State moves to:
13CF706:
Ct. 2 Operating while revoked (rev due to alc/contr sust/refusal)- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Possess Drug Paraphernalia to manufacture, compound, convert, produce, or store methamphetamine- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Possess Drug Paraphernalia- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 6 Possess Drug Paraphernalia- repeater >> D&RI
15CF693:
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- Felony- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 3 Misappropriate ID info - avoid penalry- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 4 Possess Drug Paraphernalia- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Resisting or obstructing an officer- repeater >> D&RI
15CF694:
Ct. 1 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g)- repeater- second an subsequent offense to delete "second and subsequent offense" enhancer
Ct. 3 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g)- repeater- second and subsequent offense to delete "second and subsequent offense" enhancer
Ct. 4 Bail Jumping- felony- repeater >> D&RI
Ct. 5 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g)- repeater- second and subsequent offense >> D&RI
Ct. 6 Bail Jumping- felony- repeater >> D&RI
15CF1203:
Ct. 1 Substantial Battery-intend bodily harm- repeater >> dimissed outright
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- felony- repeater >> dismissed outright
15CM2205:
Ct. 1 Battery- repeater- use of a dangerous weapon >> D&RI
Ct. 2 Disorderly Conduct- repeater- use of a dangerous weapon >> D&RI
COURT grants above
PLEA:
13CF706:
Ct. 1 Vehicle operator flee/elude officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST 
Ct. 3 Resisting or obstructing an officer- repeater >> NO CONTEST
15CF693:
Ct. 1 Possession of Methamphetamine- repeater >> NO CONTEST
15CF694:
Ct. 1 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g)- repeater  >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 Bail Jumping- felony- repeater >> NO CONTEST
Ct. 3 Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine (<=3g)- repeater >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: In 13CF706 Ct. 1: 6 years WSPS- 4 years IC, 2 years ES. On Ct. 3: 2 years WSPS-1 year IC, 1 year ES. In 15CF693 Ct. 1: 6 years WSPS- 4 years IC, 2 years. In 15CF694 Ct. 1: 8 years WSPS- 4 years IC, 4 years ES. On Ct. 2: 7 years WSPS- 4 years IC, 3 years ES. On Ct. 3: 8 years WSPS- 4 years IC, 4 years ES. All sentencing to run concurrent to each other. 439 days credit granted towards all sentencing counts. CONDITIONS OF ES: Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent. Complete AODA assessment with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, unless has valid prescription and only takes as prescribed. Maintain GFE in full time employment/schooling/combination of two. Pay CC. Pay $80 in buy back money to MC Sheriff's Dept. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample, does not need to duplicate sample if already provided. Deft is eligible for both prison programming- Challenge Incarceration & Substance Abuse Programming. 
Deft is remanded to MC Sheriff's Dept to be transported to Dodge Prison.
Atty Laufenberg to provide stipulation to court on D&RI Ct. 3-Ct. 5 in 15CF693
